name: inevitably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 in a way that cannot be avoided: Their arguments inevitably end in tears.
More examplesFewer examplesSuch a large investment inevitably entails some risk.The investigation into the air crash would inevitably apportion blame to certain members of the crew.Political leaders almost inevitably pander to big business.A war would inevitably set back the process of reform.As the political emphasis shifts, Bulgaria will inevitably become more westernized.
